comment: Dr. Clack is great. She runs a very solid course with a focus on using statistics in application settings. You do not need to have a rigorous understanding of coding in SAS. Statistics mean nothing if you cannot articulate your evidence in agreed-upon terms. Grammar, writing, and vocabulary are needed to articulate yourself.

Professor Clack is a good professor, but there are a few test questions I believe there was a disconnect on. Topics that were never covered, but are still thrown on. The class isn't super difficult, just make sure to understand how to work out SAS code and solve certain things by hand. Do the practice exams, she'll either reuse or have similar ?'s.
She is a tough grader when it comes to reports. It feels like an English class. She replies when she feels like. If you can, do not take her.

She is very annoying when it comes to grading and when you email her about how she grades you, just be ready, she will not come off as respectful at all. It took me a long time to realize but I always wondered what I did wrong to get low grades on my reports. SKIP HER CLASS! Switching online did not make things easy at all. 1 point away from an A.

Clack allows all quizzes to be open note and you are allowed to use cheat sheets on the midterm and final. If you have a certain grade in the class, you are exempted from the final. She's a great professor and makes an easily boring class fun.
Stats is a pretty easy course so for someone taking it to fulfill Gen ed requirements, I would highly recommend taking Clack. She's funny and keeps class interesting. TAKE HER!!

She's a breeze. I took her for both STAT 1107 AND 3125. In 1107, she printed out all the notes for you and it was fill in the blanks. In 3125, she still had the notes, however you have to print them out yourself. She caring and really works with you if you are stuck. You can use all of your notes on the midterm and final!

I would most definitely avoid this teacher. She is a very tough grader, a grammar nazi as well. And her midterm/final was pretty difficult. I would try to avoid her and take another bio stats professor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK
